attributes.action: Stop defining sex at birth and having to define sex on other government forms.
attributes.background: I feel before we can become an equal society we have to stop being defined by our sex, in our times it is irrelevant and we do not need to be labelled at birth and for the rest of our lives by our sex, we are all equal regardless and no longer are we protected or discriminated by our sex.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

The Government or Parliament don't define people's sex at birth, so we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could start a new petition calling for the Government to change the way births are registered or to remove sex identity from other government forms, if those are things you want to happen.
